byline.contributor: Sandra E. Garcia, Nate Schweber and Isvett Verde contributed reporting, and Susan C. Beachy contributed research.
byline.original: By BENJAMIN MUELLER and AL BAKER

abstract: Continued reluctance of witnesses to speak after gang-related murder of Freddy Collazo in South Bronx illustrates difficulty police face in gang-related criminal investigations; crime rates in New York City's 40th Precinct remain frustratingly high, as young residents continue to be caught up in generations-deep gang and personal feuds they view as best solved by gunfire and gang violence (Series: Murder in the 4-0).
lead_paragraph: The killing of Freddy Collazo remains unsolved, and the silence that frustrates detectives and torments his family seems to be holding, spawning rumors and threats of revenge.

headline.main: A Cloak of Silence After a South Bronx Killing
headline.print_headline: Cloak of Silence Descends After a Killing on a Bronx Park’s Edge

snippet: The killing of Freddy Collazo remains unsolved, and the silence that frustrates detectives and torments his family seems to be holding, spawning rumors and threats of revenge.
